intro: Ardisia ibaguensis, commonly known as the Ibaguense beautyberry, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Following flowering, it produces bright red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Ardisia ibaguensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological contributions in its native habitat.
